intro: Xanthosia tridentata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, hard, persistent seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Xanthosia tridentata is used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
